required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlative Study on Incidence and Risk Factors of Glaucoma-related Adverse Event at Various Durations After Congenital Cataract Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Correlative Study on Incidence and Risk Factors of Glaucoma-related Adverse Event at Various Durations After Congenital Cataract Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: A retrospective chart review of 264 eyes from 177 patients was performed who underwent congenital cataract surgery before the age of 14 years. All patients' surgery was performed by the same experienced surgeon at the Eye Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University from May 2011 to March 2019. We recorded patient demographics and incidence and risk factors for glaucoma-related adverse event. This study to identify the incidence of and risk factors associated with postoperative glaucoma at various durations after congenital cataract surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of glaucoma after congenital cataract surgery
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of glaucoma at various durations after congenital cataract surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Demographic data, including sex, age at surgery, gestational history, family history of cataract, and laterality of disease, were collected.

clinical_study.condition: The Incidence and Risk Factors of Glaucoma After Congenital Cataract Surgery

arm_group.description: Group 1 includes patients who underwent cataract surgery with primary IOL implantation
Group 2 includes patients who underwent cataract surgery with secondly IOL implantation
Group 3 includes patients who underwent cataract surgery without IOL implantation.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent congenital cataract surgery at Eye hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who underwent lensectomy combined with limited anterior vitrectomy, with or without IOL implantation for congenital cataract, all by one surgeon
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient had a preoperative IOP above 21mmHg, glaucoma, coexistent uveitis, metabolic syndromes/diseases or exposure to radiation.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Vice president of Eye Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
